Name: Smallpox
Comments and citation: 1796 was first test, but findings were published 2 years later. 1800 - Dr. Benjamin Waterhouse gives the smallpox vaccine to his son and other family members. These smallpox vaccinations are the first in the U.S.

Name: Rabies
Comments and citation: The first rabies vaccine was introduced in 1885 and was followed by an improved version in 1908.

Name: Diphtheria
Inventor: Emil von Behring or William Hallock Park
Comments and citation: Mixtures of diphtheria toxin and antitoxin https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-94-007-7624-1_1

Name: Pertussis
Inventor: Pearl Kendrick, Grace Eldering and Loney Gordon

Name: DTP
Inventor: Pearl Kendrick, Loney Gordon and Grace Eldering

Name: Tuberculosis
Comments and citation: BCG was adopted by the Health Committee of the League of Nations

Name: Influenza
Comments and citation: Bivalent A and B vaccine available to general population in US https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5139605/

Name: Influenza
Comments and citation: intranasally administered live attenuated vaccine, called FluMist

Name: Influenza
Comments and citation: A/H5N1 vaccine? in response to 2003-04 flu season in Asia

Name: Rotavirus
Inventor: GlaxoSmithKline and Merck (two the same year)
